cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 60 mi (95 km) SW of Ponce, Puerto Rico
cyclone.trajectory: moving W-NW across Hispaniola and Cuba, then expected to emerge over the Gulf of Mexico and head toward the central-western U.S. Gulf Coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Central Bahamas; Cuban provinces of Las Tunas, Holguin, Guantanamo, Santiago de Cuba, and Granma
weather_observation.warning_coast: Puerto Rico and U.S. Virgin Islands; northern coast of the Dominican Republic Cabo Engano to Haiti border; southern coast of the Dominican Republic Cabo Engano to Punta Palenque; northern coast of Haiti Le Mole St. Nicholas to D.R. border; southeastern Bahamas; Turks and Caicos Islands
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Leeward Islands, Puerto Rico, Hispaniola, Cuba, Bahamas, and forecast to affect the U.S. Gulf Coast from Texas to Alabama late Wed–Thu
weather_observation.wind: Minimal wind impacts expected — tropical storm winds remain well south of the Great Lakes.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None (inland freshwater port on Lake Erie)
weather_observation.rainfall: Possible remnant rainfall 1–2 inches as the weakened system or its moisture plume moves northeast late next week.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief visibility reductions and ponding on terminal surfaces; otherwise no significant tropical-cyclone-related hazards expected.
